text: Chop the roots and thick stems off the bunch of methi/fenugreek leaves. Wash and chop the rest of the leaves finely. Sprinkle a generous amount of salt on the leaves. Set aside for 15 to 20 minutes. Wash the rice well. Soak it in some water and set aside for 20 minutes. In a pan with a tightly fitting lid, heat the oil. Once it is hot, add in the cumin seeds and allow them to change color. Add the green chillies, tomatoes and turmeric powder.  Squeeze the water from methi/fenugreek leaves. Put them in the pan. Add coriander powder and red chilli powder. Cook for a couple of minutes. Drain the water from the rice. Add the rice to the cooking mixture for 2 minutes. Add water and mix well. On high heat, allow the rice to cook until most of the water evaporates. Lower the heat. Let simmer for 15 minutes. Open the cover and turn off heat. Mix/fluff gently. Allow the rice to rest before serving. Finished.
